sections.title: Are you legally established within the United Kingdom?

fields.label: Are you legally established within the United Kingdom?
fields.helpText: This means you have a registered office, central headquarters or a permanent business establishment in the United Kingdom
fields.errorMessage: Select whether you are legally established within the United Kingdom

sections.title: You cannot apply for Transitional Simplified Procedures

fields.infoText: You will not be able to continue as you are not legally established within the United Kingdom

fields.label: EORI reference
fields.helpText: This includes the country code followed by up to 15 numbers, for example GB123456789123

fields.infoText:
Email is not 100% secure, as it is sent over the internet.

This means it is possible for an email to be intercepted and altered.

Because of this, HMRC reduces the risk to your details wherever possible, for example by only quoting part of unique reference numbers.

We also make sure we only communicate with established business contacts at their correct email addresses.

fields.label: Do you agree to let us contact you by email about your application?
fields.errorMessage: Select whether you consent to being contacted using your email address
optionHelpText: We will use telephone or post if we need to contact you about your application

fields.label: Is the registered office address the same as your business address?
fields.helpText: Your registered office must be based in the UK
fields.errorMessage: Select whether the registered office address is the same as your business address

fields.label: Registered UK office address
fields.helpText: Your registered office must be based in the UK

sections.title: Do you have a new Direct Trader Input (DTI) badge?

fields.label: Do you have a new Direct Trader Input (DTI) badge?
fields.helpText: If you want to use a new DTI badge to submit your Supplementary Declaration, you need to provide the badge details
fields.errorMessage: Select whether you have a new Direct Trader Input (DTI) badge

fields.label: Community Service Provider (CSP) operator details for this badge
fields.helpText: For example, Pentant, CNS, CCS, FCP, DHB

sections.title: Do you expect to move goods that attract duty?

fields.label: Do you expect to move goods that attract duty?
fields.errorMessage: Select whether you expect to move goods that attract duty
optionHelpText: Check before you import and contact HMRC about setting up a Duty Deferment Account (DDA)

fields.label: Is your business VAT registered?
fields.errorMessage: Select whether your business is VAT registered

fields.label: VAT registration number
fields.helpText: This is GB followed by 9 numbers, for example GB123456789. You can find this on your VAT registration certificate.

sections.title: Do you intend to use VAT Postponed Accounting?
sections.shortName: Intent to use VAT Postponed Accounting

fields.label: Do you intend to use VAT Postponed Accounting?
fields.errorMessage: Select whether you intend to use VAT Postponed Accounting

fields.label: What is VAT Postponed Accounting?
fields.infoText:
If the UK leaves the EU without an agreement, the government will introduce Postponed Accounting for import VAT on goods brought into the UK.

This means that UK VAT registered businesses importing goods will not pay import VAT at the time the goods arrive at the UK border.
Instead, they will be able to account for import VAT on their VAT return.

This will apply both to imports from the EU and non-EU countries.

sections.title: Do you hold or have access to a Duty Deferment Account (DDA)?

fields.label: Do you hold or have access to a Duty Deferment Account (DDA)?
fields.errorMessage: Select whether you hold or have access to a Duty Deferment Account (DDA)
optionHelpText: Based on your previous answers, you will need to hold or have access to a Duty Deferement Account by the time you submit a declaration that will attract duty

fields.label: What is a Duty Deferment Account?
fields.infoText:
You have to pay VAT and Import Duty when you import goods to the UK. 

You can use the Duty Deferment Scheme (DDS) to make monthly payments to HMRC through a Deferment Approval Number (DAN).

To use the DDS, you have to give HMRC a guarantee through your bank that you can meet the cost of all your VAT and duties.

sections.title: Do you intend to move controlled goods?

fields.label: Do you intend to move controlled goods?
fields.errorMessage: Select whether you intend to move controlled goods

fields.label: What are controlled goods?
fields.infoText:
Controlled goods require a licence for import or export.

These include:

* military and paramilitary goods
* dual-use technology (civilian goods which can be used for military purposes, like machine tools or marine equipment)
* artworks
* plants and animals
* medicines and chemicals

By signing below I confirm that the information given in this form is true, complete and accurate and that I will notify HMRC when I import goods to the UK, including all appropriate customs declarations.

I confirm that I will pay the customs duties for which I may be liable on those imports.

fields.label: Provide details below of who is signing the declaration
Job role
fields.helpText: For example, director, financial controller or secretary

fields.label: Email address
fields.helpText: To receive confirmation that your return has been submitted, enter an email address below

fields.infoText:
This is your last opportunity to print or save a PDF copy of your submitted form.

We have received your registration request for Transitional Simplified Procedures (TSP). 

For further information see the TSP guidance page
